name: PK Ilmarine Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I enjoyed a weekend in Tallinn in March 2007, we stayed at the Domina Ilmarine.
reviews.title: Great Weekend In Tallinn

likes.liked: — Under Tile Heating In The Bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving in Tallinn the best way to reach the hotel is via local bus which leaves from outside the airport terminal (there is a sign post marked 'City Bus') Take the No. 2 bus to Reisisadam, which is the last stop and is near the Harbour, the hotel is a short walk to the west.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It is located at the edge of the Old Town approximately 200m away. The surrounding area is very atmospheric with Soviet rail tracks, bunkers and port facilities.
reviews.title: Good Choice

likes.liked: — Quality of the accommodation and the location
likes.disliked: — The windows externally could do with a bit of a clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly and the rooms are good. The bar isn't a rip off and breakfast is good too. There was some building work going on outside, but its nice to see that the city is growing and expanding with increasing investment.
reviews.title: Smart modern hotel close to ferry port and old town

reviews.text: I would well recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Clean

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, just outside the walls of the Old Town and not far from the harbour. It is roughly a 5-10min walk to the centre of the Old Town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are tasefully decorated and comfortable. They definately have more af a premium feel than some other hotels I have stayed at in a similar price range. I agree with a previous reviewer that the only disappointing thing is that the towels in the bathroom aren't very fluffy - but that's the only thing I can complain about, so hardly a big deal!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Check-in was speedy and efficient, and all the front desk staff that we spoke to were friendly and helpful. There's free internet access in the lobby, and although there is only one computer, it was never busy and was very helpful when looking up addresses of bars etc. in the town.
reviews.title: WARNING: Hotel charged me again for a prepaid booking

reviews.text: I had read a guidebook review of the hotel which said that all of the rooms were duplexes with kitchenettes, however, our rooms were just regular hotel rooms, no kitchen or separate bedroom, so don't be mislead if you read that anywhere. I certainly don't think the hotel website makes this assertion.
reviews.title: Good value for money
Very Nice hotel
reviews.text: I think this hotel is very good value for money and I would definately recommend it to my family and friends.

Room: was great. Got two double beds. Not the most comfortable bed but ok to get a good night sleep after exploring the area.The bathroom was really good. Overall clean room. The hotel had a nice architecture and the area was very clean. Typical European architecture
reviews.title: Great rooms, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: About a 10 min walk from the ferry port. Straight walk on the road. If you are taking the Tallink ferries its an additional 5 mins walk as the ferries arrive on the other side of the terminal. To the old town entrance on the south its a 10 minute walk. Perfect location to explore the old town and walk back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good quality and good value
Mediocre hotel with staff low trained
reviews.text: I did not use taxi's while I was here as I had heard about the rip-offs. It was safe walking in the night to the hotel.
Service:
reviews.title: Perfect in all you cn expect in Estonia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would give it about a 2*. I think the hotel was full the other day so their service was poor. I asked for an Iron twice and they never brought it to my room. Long check-in time - took about 20 mins to get checked in. In general the staff were unfriendly. I heard about 2 customers complaining and yelling at the staff as they hadn't received a good room.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — no tea and coffee making facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Domina Ilmarine for 4 nights in January after booking (a very very cheap deal) with Easyjet.
reviews.title: Not a 4* hotel- but a pleasant stay nethertheless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First thing first..... this isn't a four star hotel... whatever you may be told... there is no swimming pool, the jacuzzi and sauna can be used- but at a cost (very cheeky if you ask me) and the beauty salon- I'm not sure if its any more than a room with a sign above the door!!! There was no iron, hairdryer or tea making facilities provided in the room, and the TV was very small with poor reception. However the hotel is very near the old town... its a 10 minute walk into the centre- and I must say that it is an extremely pleasant walk.
reviews.title: Beware!!!!

likes.liked: — within easy walking distance of town
likes.disliked: — very little amenities for a 4* hotel

reviews.text: Getting on to the meaty stuff... We booked a double room and upon arrival were given keys to a twin room that hadn't even been cleaned since the previous guests had checked out!!! We went back to reception and were immediately given another room without question.
reviews.title: Worked Well for Us

likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee in the room

reviews.text: Our room itself was of average size, the bathroom was modern- shower and bath combi... with the standard industrial strength toiletries you get. The bedding was clean WHITE linen ( I have a thing about old flowered hotel bedlinen that hotels seem to love- as you never know what stains are lurking about!) Overall the room was very pleasant and clean, with fitted wardrobes (only 3 hangers), a minibar and the small TV. I didn't use the restaurant so I cannot comment on the food, however I sat in the bar area- which is connected to the restaurant as this is the only place that there is wireless connection (unsecured though so if you are using the internet for anything personal or sensitive please be aware- oh and it shuts by 9pm).
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.text: I have given this hotel 3/5 as the ammenties are not what they should be- but he rooms are clean, fair sized and fairly new, the people/staff are friendly/helpful and it is a good location. If you are going for a weekend and are getting a good deal for the room I would reccommend.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Tallinn

likes.disliked: — The path leading to the hotel was more car than pedestrian friendly but OK

description: PK Ilmarine Hotel is a charming hotel conveniently located just near the historical Old Town, in the culturally versatile seaside region of Tallinn. It is only a few minutes' walk from the ferry terminal, railway station, and the city business, entertainment and shopping districts. With its bar & restaurant Wiegand, beauty salon Angel's Rose, the gym, sauna & relaxation area, free WiFi and parking, Ilmarine will be everything you expect from a "home away from home".
